alert.note: Alert for Alger; Baraga; Houghton; Keweenaw; Luce; Marquette; Northern Schoolcraft; Ontonagon; Southern Houghton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 11 at 4:11AM EST until January 13 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations in excess of 6 inches are expected across most of the area Friday into Saturday. Local amounts in excess of a foot are possible in Marquette County. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph...strongest near the Lake Superior shoreline. * WHERE...Portions of central Upper and western Upper Michigan. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening through Saturday evening commutes. Strong winds coupled with heavy wet snow could cause tree damage and potential power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heavier and wet snow will move in starting Friday afternoon. Snow will be heaviest and wettest Friday afternoon into Saturday morning. Lake effect snow will occur Saturday afternoon with the snow becoming fluffier which will allow it to blow and drift around.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
